Maselli n~n° April 9, 1987 RE: Center of Excellence in Toxicology Weekly Highlights - Week Ending April 3, 1987 • Dr. Dan Funk, Del Monte Tropical Fruite, had asked for information on Tilt, a CIBA-Geigy fungicide used on bananas. The fungicide is permitted in other countries but is not approved in the United States. CIBA-Geigy has asked for a residue tolerance of 0.2 ppm and expects clearance by the EPA in May or June, 1987. • The WHO/FAO Codex Committee on Food Additives is endorsing too many food additives according to Germany, Switzerland and Poland. The Joint Expert Committee on Food Additives (JECFA) decided to evaluate natural products on a case-by-case basis instead of establishing a blanket policy. The listing of Sucralose, the artificial sweetener by Johnson & Johnson, on the next JECFA agenda may have angered FDA. The United States delegation would have preferred to evaluate Sucralose through FDA before placing this item into an international forum. • Mr. Dave Taylor will go to Costa Rica to evaluate potential employee exposure to methyl bromide. Del Monte Tropical Fruit uses methyl bromide to fumigate pineapples for insects. AWH:7P cc: Dr. G. R. Di Marco Dr. Dr. J r. r. Mr. J. R. R. R. W. C. E. E. L. D.
